    • Uses of City in pa1.ministers

      Methods in pa1.ministers with parameters of type City 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void Minister.attackCity​(City attacker, City defender, int attackingTroops, List<Technology> technologyList)
      Attack a target city Attacking city loses troops equal to min(# of troops attacking, # of troops in the defending city) Defending city loses round(0.8 * # of attacking troops * product of tech attack bonuses)
      void WarGeneral.attackCity​(City attacker, City defender, int troops, List<Technology> technologyList)
      WarGeneral gets attack bonus when attacking a city.
      void Minister.buildBank​(Player player, City city)
      Build a bank in the city 1.
      void Minister.buildRoad​(Player player, City city)
      Build a road in the city 1.
      void Minister.buildUniversity​(Player player, City city)
      Build a university in the city 1.
      int Minister.collectProductionPoints​(City city)
      Collect production points from a city amount collected = (city population + minister intelligence + minister leadership) * (# of roads + 1) * 0.2
      int WarGeneral.collectProductionPoints​(City city)  
      int Minister.collectSciencePoints​(City city)
      Collect science points from a city amount collected = (city population + minister experience + minister intelligence) * (# of universities + 1) * 0.2
      int Scientist.collectSciencePoints​(City city)  
      int Economist.collectTax​(City city)  
      int Minister.collectTax​(City city)
      Collect gold from a city amount collected = (city population + minister experience + minister leadership) * (# of banks + 1) * 0.2
      void Economist.improveCropYield​(Player player, City city)
      Economists get a bonus when doing crops improvements Crop improvement still costs 500 gold Crop is improved by 50 + round((intelligence + experience + leadership) * 0.2) If the player does not have enough gold, throw an exception Else decrease 500 golds from the player and improves crops by the calculated amount
      void Minister.improveCropYield​(Player player, City city)
      Improve the crop yields in a city Improve Crop yields by 50 for 500 golds If the player does not have enough gold, throw an exception Else decrease 500 golds from the player and improves crops by 50
      void Minister.recruitTroops​(Player player, City city)
      Recruit troops to be stationed in a city Recruit 50 troops for 500 golds If the player does not have enough gold, throw an exception
      void WarGeneral.recruitTroops​(Player player, City city)
      Recruits more troops than superclass implementation, troops added to city = 50 + round(leadership * 0.2).
      void Minister.spyOnNeighbors​(City city, GameMap map)
      This method is called you want to spy on your neighbors.
